etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Recreation. From jacklight + -er

definitions: A person who uses a jacklight to illuminate, attract, dazzle, or mesmerize game (especially deer) or fish when hunting or fishing at night; a hunter or fisherman who engages in jacklighting. Compare "lamper", spotlighter.

notes.text: In many jurisdictions this method of hunting or fishing is restricted or prohibited by law.
